Some R Notes Chapter 1 Bookdown Notes 1.1 Number and reference equations

Some R Notes Xiaojie Gao Chapter 1 Bookdown Notes 1.1 Number and reference equations Note: I copied this section from Authoring Books with R Markdown. More tips can be found there! To number and refer to equations, put them in the equation environments and assign labels to them using the syntax (\#eq:label), e.g., \begin{equation} f\left(k\right) = \binom{n}{k} p^k\left(1-p\right)^{n-k} (\#eq:binom) \end{equation} It renders the equation below: \[\begin{equation} f\left(k\right) = \binom{n}{k} p^k\left(1-p\right)^{n-k} \tag{1.1} \end{equation}\] You may refer to it using \@ref(eq:binom), e.g., see Equation (1.1).
